page.title: 18Snowstorm - Spring 1985
page.content: In the early hours of 22nd January I awoke and found we had no light! It was still dark but through the snow packed window I could see lots of snow drifts in the moonlight. In the morning I went with Dad to dig out the snowplough. We cleared 200 metres and stuck. It was three days before we got one road open! On all the roads the electricity poles were down or leaning over and the wires hanging and through the nights it still snowed. Many sheep froze to death .The gamekeepers used Argos to bring groceries to outlying homes. Through the long nights we played games by the light of the tilley lamp. Most people cooked on camping stoves. Electricity was switched on after five days but the surrounding areas were nine days without power.
